base_note.note_text:
PROCEDURE NOTE
Date: 2025-05-15 | Patient: Henry Smith | MRN: 2189773
Attending: Dr. Angela Morrison, MD | Location: Memorial Hospital, Houston, TX

PROCEDURE: Indwelling pleural catheter access and drainage

INDICATION: Established left PleurX catheter (placed 3 weeks ago) for malignant mesothelioma with recurrent effusion. Patient reports increased dyspnea and has not been able to drain at home due to suspected catheter occlusion.

PROCEDURE: Under sterile technique, the PleurX catheter was accessed. Initial aspiration revealed thick loculated fluid. The catheter was flushed with 10mL saline with return of cloudy fluid. A total of 850mL of serosanguinous fluid was drained. tPA 4mg/40mL NS was instilled per protocol for suspected fibrinous occlusion. Patient to clamp for 2 hours then attempt drainage.

SPECIMENS: Pleural fluid to cytology, culture

COMPLICATIONS: None

PLAN: Home health to continue daily drainage. Return if unable to drain. Consider fibrinolytic protocol if recurrent.

Angela Morrison, MD

code_rationales.32557: IPC access with drainage and tPA instillation for partial occlusion.

cpt_codes.description: Pleural drainage, percutaneous, with insertion of indwelling catheter; with imaging guidance

changes: Populated registry_entry.billing from ip_coding_billing.v2_7 for CPT codes 32557; total_work_rvu=3.12, total_rvu=4.5 (facility).

INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY PROCEDURE DOCUMENTATION
============================================================

PATIENT IDENTIFICATION AND DEMOGRAPHICS
----------------------------------------
Patient: Carolyn Barnes
Medical Record Number: 9420707
Date of Birth: N/A
Age at Procedure: N/A years
Procedure Date: 2024-04-27

CLINICAL INDICATION AND PREOPERATIVE ASSESSMENT
----------------------------------------
The patient presented with ipc access - malignant mesothelioma effusion. Following comprehensive multidisciplinary evaluation and informed consent discussion detailing procedural risks, benefits, and alternatives, the patient elected to proceed with the proposed intervention.

PROCEDURAL METHODOLOGY AND TECHNIQUE
----------------------------------------

Ipc:


INTRAPROCEDURAL FINDINGS
----------------------------------------
Detailed airway examination was performed with findings as documented in the procedural narrative.


POSTPROCEDURAL ASSESSMENT AND DISPOSITION
----------------------------------------
The procedure was completed without immediate complications. The patient demonstrated hemodynamic stability throughout and was transferred to the recovery area in satisfactory condition.

PROCEDURAL CODING DOCUMENTATION
----------------------------------------
Current Procedural Terminology Codes: 32557

This documentation has been prepared in accordance with institutional standards for procedural documentation and coding compliance.

PROCEDURE NOTE

Date: 2024-11-30
Patient: Gerald Cox
MRN: 8092402
Age/Sex: Noneyo patient

Attending Physician: [Attending]
Resident/Fellow: [Trainee, PGY-X]

INDICATION:
IPC access - malignant mesothelioma effusion

CONSENT:
Informed consent obtained. Risks, benefits, and alternatives discussed.
Patient verbalized understanding and agreed to proceed.

TIMEOUT:
Performed. Correct patient, procedure, and site confirmed.

SEDATION:
None

PROCEDURE STEPS:
1. Patient positioned and monitored
2. Sedation administered per protocol
3. Topical anesthesia applied to airway
4. Ipc performed
5. Scope withdrawn
6. Patient recovered without complication

SPECIMENS:
Pleural fluid to cytology, culture

COMPLICATIONS:
None

EBL:
Minimal

DISPOSITION:
To recovery, stable condition

CPT CODES: 32557

ATTESTATION:
I was present for the entire procedure and agree with the above documentation.
[Attending Signature]

variations.note_text:
On 2025-03-31, Angela Hughes, a None-year-old patient (MRN 1742486), underwent bronchoscopic evaluation for IPC access - malignant mesothelioma effusion. The patient received None and the procedure was performed in standard fashion. The procedure included ipc. 

On examination, the airways were systematically inspected. The procedure was completed without immediate complications. 

The patient tolerated the procedure well and was transferred to the recovery area in stable condition. Specimens obtained were sent for appropriate analysis and results will be reviewed at follow-up. The preliminary assessment is malignancy. 

Procedural coding: 32557.
